segment.source: Signing a Driver During Development and Testing
segment.target: Signing a Driver During Development and Testing

segment.source: Before you install a driver on a computer running a 64-bit version of Windows, you must sign the driver package.
segment.target: Before you install a driver on a computer running a 64-bit version of Windows, you must sign the driver package.

segment.source: For testing purposes, you can test sign the driver package, which is a more relaxed form of signing than signing for public release.
segment.target: For testing purposes, you can test sign the driver package, which is a more relaxed form of signing than signing for public release.

segment.source: In Microsoft Visual Studio, test signing is enabled by default.
segment.target: In Microsoft Visual Studio, test signing is enabled by default.

segment.source: Suppose you have created a KMDF driver solution as described in Writing a KMDF driver based on a template.
segment.target: Suppose you have created a KMDF driver solution as described in Writing a KMDF driver based on a template.

segment.source: When you build the solution, you can see in the Output window that the driver package has been test signed.
segment.target: When you build the solution, you can see in the Output window that the driver package has been test signed.

segment.source: Screen shot of the Output windowEnabling test signing manually
segment.target: Screen shot of the Output windowEnabling test signing manually

segment.source: To manually enable test signing, follow these steps.
segment.target: To manually enable test signing, follow these steps.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, open a solution that has a driver package project.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, open a solution that has a driver package project.

segment.source: Right-click the driver package project, and choose Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the driver package project, and choose Properties.

segment.source: In the property pages for the package, navigate to Configuation Properties Driver Signing General.
segment.target: In the property pages for the package, navigate to Configuation Properties Driver Signing General.

segment.source: In the Sign Mode drop-down list, select Test Sign.
segment.target: In the Sign Mode drop-down list, select Test Sign.

segment.source: In the property pages for the package, navigate to Configuation Properties Inf2Cat General.
segment.target: In the property pages for the package, navigate to Configuation Properties Inf2Cat General.

segment.source: In the Run Inf2Cat drop-down list, select Yes.
segment.target: In the Run Inf2Cat drop-down list, select Yes.

segment.source: Viewing the signed driver package
segment.target: Viewing the signed driver package

segment.source: After you build your solution, navigate in File Explorer to the folder that contains your driver package.
segment.target: After you build your solution, navigate in File Explorer to the folder that contains your driver package.

segment.source: One of the files in the package is a catalog file.
segment.target: One of the files in the package is a catalog file.

segment.source: The catalog file contains the digital signature for the package.
segment.target: The catalog file contains the digital signature for the package.

segment.source: For an example of viewing the files in a signed package, see Writing a KMDF driver based on a template.
segment.target: For an example of viewing the files in a signed package, see Writing a KMDF driver based on a template.

segment.source: Sharing a signing certificate
segment.target: Sharing a signing certificate

segment.source: When you test sign a driver package, Visual Studio creates a signing certificate (PFX file) and imports it into a certificate store on your host computer.
segment.target: When you test sign a driver package, Visual Studio creates a signing certificate (PFX file) and imports it into a certificate store on your host computer.

segment.source: When you deploy your test-signed driver package to a test computer, Visual Studio copies a verification certificate (CER file) to the test computer.
segment.target: When you deploy your test-signed driver package to a test computer, Visual Studio copies a verification certificate (CER file) to the test computer.

segment.source: If you want to share the certificate with developers who are building drivers on other host computers, you must share the signing certificate, not the verification certificate.
segment.target: If you want to share the certificate with developers who are building drivers on other host computers, you must share the signing certificate, not the verification certificate.

segment.source: To share the signing certificate, follow these steps.
segment.target: To share the signing certificate, follow these steps.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, in the Solution Explorer window, right-click your driver package project, and choose Properties.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, in the Solution Explorer window, right-click your driver package project, and choose Properties.

segment.source: In the property pages for the package, navigate to Configuation Properties Driver Signing General.
segment.target: In the property pages for the package, navigate to Configuation Properties Driver Signing General.

segment.source: In the Test Certificate field, choose Select From Store.
segment.target: In the Test Certificate field, choose Select From Store.

segment.source: In the Select Certificate dialog box, locate your test-signing certificate.
segment.target: In the Select Certificate dialog box, locate your test-signing certificate.

segment.source: The name of the certificate will be similar to WDKTestCert yourName.
segment.target: The name of the certificate will be similar to WDKTestCert yourName.

segment.source: Select your test-signing certificate, and click Properties.
segment.target: Select your test-signing certificate, and click Properties.

segment.source: In the Details tab, click Copy to File.
segment.target: In the Details tab, click Copy to File.

segment.source: Follow the instructions in the Certificate Export Wizard to export a PFX file.
segment.target: Follow the instructions in the Certificate Export Wizard to export a PFX file.

segment.source: When you are asked whether you want to export the private key, select Yes, export the private key.
segment.target: When you are asked whether you want to export the private key, select Yes, export the private key.

segment.source: Share the exported PFX file with the other developers.
segment.target: Share the exported PFX file with the other developers.
